chapter.title: Hibernate Migration Errors
chapter.para: This chapter describes describes a few of the problems, causes, and solutions found when migrating from a legacy Hibernate project to a JPA project. Most of the issues involved integration with hibernate3-maven-plugin.

section.title: Missing hibernate-entitymanager
section.para: This error occurs when using the hibernate3-maven-plugin and the project does not declare a dependency on the hibernate-entitymanager.

section.title: Symptom: NoClassDefFoundError: org.hibernate.cfg.Configuration
section.programlisting: [ERROR] Failed to execute goal org.codehaus.mojo:hibernate3-maven-plugin:3.0:run (generate-drop-hbm) on project hibernate-hbm2: There was an error creating the AntRun task. An Ant BuildException has occured: java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/hibernate/cfg/Configuration: org.hibernate.cfg.Configuration

section.title: Cause: Missing dependency on hibernate-entitymanager
section.para: The error occurs because the plugin has no hibernate artifact to provide it the necessary classes. That could be due to....

listitem.para: The dependency on hibernate-entitymanager was either missing or declared scope=test or provided.
The plugin did not declare a dependency on hibernate-entitymanager to compensate for the module not having a scope=compile dependency.

section.title: Solution: Declare plugin dependency on hibernate-entitymanager
section.para: Either the module or the module plugin must have a dependency on hibernate-entitymanager to have the missing class(es) be resolved for DDL generation.

section.title: Mixed Hibernate Versions with plugin and JPA
section.para: This error is caused when there is a version of hibernate in your project that conflicts with the default version used by the hibernate3-maven-plugin.

section.title: Symptom: NoSuchMethodException: org.hibernate.validator.ClassValidator.<init>(...)
section.para: When using the JPA aspects of the plugin you may notice the following.
section.programlisting: Failed to execute goal org.codehaus.mojo:hibernate3-maven-plugin:2.2:hbm2ddl (generate-drop-hbm) on project hibernate-orm: Execution generate-drop-hbm of goal org.codehaus.mojo:hibernate3-maven-plugin:2.2:hbm2ddl failed: [PersistenceUnit: hibernate-migration-sales] Unable to configure EntityManagerFactory: java.lang.NoSuchMethodException: org.hibernate.validator.ClassValidator.<init>(java.lang.Class, java.util.ResourceBundle, org.hibernate.validator.MessageInterpolator, java.util.Map, org.hibernate.annotations.common.reflection.ReflectionManager)

section.title: Cause: Using JPAConfiguration and version mis-matches
section.para: This error is caused by using the JPA configuration of the plugin and not having all dependencies aligned.

section.title: Solution: Declare plugin dependency on hibernate-entitymanager
section.para: Declare a dependency on hibernate-entitymanager within the plugin to control the version brought in when using the JPA extentions.

section.title: slf4j version mis-matches with later versions of Hibernate
section.para: Issues with hibernate and slf4j start appearing with some of the later versions of hibernate 3.x. where they switched dependencies from slf4j1.5.8 to 1.6.1.

section.title: Symptom: NoClassDefFoundError: org.slf4j.helpers.NOPLoggerFactory
section.programlisting: [ERROR] Failed to execute goal org.codehaus.mojo:hibernate3-maven-plugin:3.0:run (generate-drop-hbm) on project hibernate-annotated-jpa: There was an error creating the AntRun task. An Ant BuildException has occured: java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/slf4j/helpers/NOPLoggerFactory: org.slf4j.helpers.NOPLoggerFactory

section.title: Cause: plugin dependency on hibernate-entitymanager causes slf4j-api version mis-match
section.para: In this case we have created a plugin dependency on hibernate-entitymanager for the plugin using version 3.5.0-Final. This brought in slf4j-api version 1.5.8 which collided with logging done within the plugin.

section.title: Solution: Exclude slf4j-api from plugin dependency
Summary
section.para: In this chapter we listed some error messages, described the causes, and provided solutions. When in doubt, you can also take a look at the source modules that were used to build the examples provided.
